summary.long: Philemon is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother,
To Philemon, our beloved fellow laborer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to beloved Apphia, and to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God, always mentioning you in my prayers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whenever I hear of your love and faith, which you have toward the Lord Jesus and for all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the sharing of your faith may be most effective by the acknowledgment of every good thing which is in you from Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have great joy and encouragement on account of your love, because the hearts of the saints are refreshed through you, brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, though I might be very bold in Christ to command you to do that which is proper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet for love’s sake I rather appeal to you—I, Paul, an old man, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I appeal to you on behalf of my son Onesimus, whose father I have become in my imprisonment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who in the past was unprofitable to you, but now he is profitable to you and to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent him back. Therefore receive him as my own heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wanted to keep him with me, so that in your place he might serve me during my imprisonment for the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But without your consent I would do nothing, so that your goodness would not be forced, but given willingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps this was why he departed for a while, that you might receive him forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: no longer as a slave but more than a slave, a beloved brother, especially to me but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you consider me a partner, receive him as you would me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he wronged you or owes you anything, charge this to my account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, have written this with my own hand. I will repay it—not to mention that you owe me even your own self.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, brother, help me rejoice in the Lord, refresh my heart in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being convinced of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will also do more than I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, in addition, prepare also lodging for me, for I hope that through your prayers I shall be graciously restored to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow laborers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
